abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Shanghai Sewerage Project for
            China had the following ratings: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was highly likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory. The
            lessons learned indicate that continuity and quality of key
            personnel from both Bank and Borrower sides are important to
            ensure success. Project Office should include personnel with
            utility and environmental management skills, and emphasize
            construction management expertise. With bold implementation
            approaches, new technologies can be applied for improved
            project effectiveness and efficiency. The usefulness of
            public/private partnerships for wastewater operations,
            possibly through Build-Operate-Transfer (BOT) or concession
            arrangements, is acknowledged for system improvements and
            operational Efficiency. More emphasis on very large
            International Competitive Bidding (ICB) turn-key contracts
            in future similar projects may encourage foreign/local joint
            venture firms to participate, with potentially stronger
            construction management skills. Civil works contracts in
            infrastructure projects in Shanghai do not attract any
            interest internationally, even when contracts are packaged
            in amounts exceeding $10.0 million. Local area sewer
            networks and related connections should be included in
            project scope, or otherwise legislated by government, to
            ensure appropriate and timely utilization of trunk sewer
            systems. Monitoring indicators are an important means of
            assessing project achievements. Monitoring of project impact
            should be closely coordinated among involved agencies, and
            data shared to avoid duplicated efforts.

repnme.cdata!:
China - Shanghai Second Sewerage Project -
            supplementary statement of environmental impact assessment
            for reclamation project of wastewater treatment plant

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Shanghai Sewerage Project
            (SSPII) will involve a reclamation project at the
            Bailonggang to improve the water environment of the Huangpu
            River, protect the water quality of the upper Huangpu water
            supply intake, and speed up the development of Pudong New
            Area. This supplemental statement of environmental impact
            assessment came as a result of the changing of land
            acquisition option for the sewerage treatment plant, which
            may change the result from the original environmental
            assessment done in 1995 (E127). Filling spoil left from the
            reclamation project will be used to build the Bailonggang
            embankment. To mitigate the impact of dust, spoil stockpiles
            and roads will be regularly sprinkled with water. To reduce
            noise from the vehicles for spoil transportation, roads and
            bridges will be widened and harnessed to accelerate the
            speed of transportation. During the construction period,
            wastewater must be discharged into septic tank and then
            carried away regularly by local sanitation department. Odor
            generated from wastewater process will be mitigated by
            laying sewerage discharge pipes, and utilizing land to plant
            trees and conduct greenery projects. Compensation will be
            arranged to tackle the economic loss of the fishermen and
            farmers affected duirng the construction.

5079901.trustfund:
TF033513-CHINA - SECOND SHANGHAI
            SEWERAGE PROJECT,TF032244-CHINA - ENVIRONMENT,TF030302-AUSTRIA GENERAL CTF FY03 - ALL
            BUT ECA,TF020464-NORWEIGIAN CTF SHANGHAI
            SEWERAGE PRJ 2,TF032008-CHINA - ENVIRONMENT,TF032972-CHINA - SECOND SHANGHAI SEWERAGE,TF020354-DANISH CTF: CHINA ENVIRONMENT,TF031930-CHINA - SECOND SHANGHAI
            SEWERAGE PROJECT,TF031932-CHINA - SECOND SHANGHAI
            SEWERAGE PROJECT,TF031287-CHINA - DEVELOPMENT PLANNING
5079901.majtheme: Urban development,Environment and natural resource management

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Shanghai Sewerage Project is
            part of the next phase of Shanghai Municipality's
            development program to improve environmental conditions and
            management. The overriding project objective is to provide a
            safe environmental setting for the long-term growth of
            Shanghai, enabling sustained economic and industrial growth.
            Specific objectives of the project are to: 1) enhance
            wastewater and stormwater management through expanding
            wastewater collection, pretreatment and disposal capacity
            and stormwater drainage facilities; 2) reduce urban
            pollution impact, while facilitating pollution control; 3)
            improve wastewater utility financial and operational
            management; and 4) strengthen sector institutions through
            training, feasibility studies, and future investment project
            preparation in the environment area. The project will
            comprise: 1) financial and policy initiatives, planning,
            institutional and management reforms; and 2) an investment
            program of environmentally-oriented capital works and
            institutional measures to support management and operational
            capacity-building of Shanghai Municipal Sewerage Company
            Ltd. The investment program will consist of the following
            components: (a) sewerage and sanitation improvements; (b)
            wastewater treatment and disposal systems; and (c)
            institutional development and training.

            SEWERAGE PROJECT,TF031287-CHINA - DEVELOPMENT PLANNING

repnme.cdata!:
China - Second Shanghai Sewerage Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This report was prepared as part of a
            study carried out for the preparation of the Second Shanghai
            Sewerage Project (SSPII), which is included in the World
            Bank's three year lending program for China.  It has
            been produced to meet the requirements of the Government of
            China and the World Bank.  The objectives of this
            environmental impact assessment include the following: 1)
            surveying and assessing the environmental status in the
            project construction areas and surrounding areas; 2)
            identifying and assessing the potential impacts of the
            project during its construction and later operation; 3)
            analyzing the social and environmental benefits of the
            project; 4) recommending measures and related policies for
            mitigating potential impacts, to be adopted by the project
            developer and project operation units; 5) preparing the
            required environmental management and monitoring plan; and
            6) avoiding and mitigating possible adverse impacts of the
            construction project on the environment and ensuring that
            the project generates a net benefit.

            environmental assessment
